title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Panama is inefficiently using its resources and/or does not explain that it is producing at a point below its production possibilities curve.
The response states that Panama is inefficiently using its resources and explains that it is producing at a point below its production possibilities curve.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Panama has the comparative advantage in the production of tangerines and/or does not explain that Panama has the lower opportunity cost in producing tangerines: the opportunity cost of producing one unit of tangerines in Panama is 0.04 unit of bananas and in Mexico it is 0.2 unit of bananas.

The response states that Panama has the comparative advantage in the production of tangerines and explains that Panama has the lower opportunity cost in producing tangerines: the opportunity cost of producing one unit of tangerines in Panama is 0.04 unit of bananas and in Mexico it is 0.2 unit of bananas.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that no, Mexico will not gain from trade and/or does not explain that these terms of trade are less than Mexico’s opportunity cost of producing bananas.
The response states that no, Mexico will not gain from trade and explains that these terms of trade are less than Mexico’s opportunity cost of producing bananas.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Panama’s opportunity cost of producing bananas will increase and/or does not explain that it will have to give up more units of tangerines to produce each unit of bananas.
The response states that Panama’s opportunity cost of producing bananas will increase and explains that it will have to give up more units of tangerines to produce each unit of bananas.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the number of employed people in Panama as 19 million and/or does not show the work.
